Articles.Content:
So I bought this game on steam, called "distance" (its %50 off right now), and I find it incredibly addictive. Its even pulling me away from playing Counter-strike:source, and I've been logging hours in that for a decade now. The lights in the environment pulse with the music, and its just a delight for the senses.

This game is amazing, any fellow forumites play?

Indeed! Distance is incredibly fun (and very well polished as well. Its perhaps one of the best Early Access I've ever played). I've had it for about a year now, but I've only sunk about 43 hours into so far (I'm mainly waiting for new campaign levels and features). Actually... Now that you mention it, I think its about time I checked in on the new community levels...

Have you tried the community levels yet? The level editor in Distance is really powerful and allows for a lot of crazy track designs. The quality of some of those community levels is absolutely stunning.
I played Nictronic rush a long time ago, the fact that this came out is awesome! (I saw the kickstarter awhile ago) it's also very fun to chop the car in pieces
